fields.description:
Items to address here:
- Increase modal dialog width (to large size?)
- Reduce modal dialog padding a bit
- Adjust label/field column proportions (especially in alarms actions section) to minimize label wrapping
- Support ability to close dialog when clicking outside it (similar to Foundation Reveal)
- Support slide-down animation on dialog enter, and slide-up on dialog leave (nice to have)
fields.summary: Cloudwatch - Create Alarm Dialog Layout Updates

comments.body: [~dkavanagh]: I can't reproduce the example you provided in the screenshot here.  Was that taken on master?
That was on GUI-2466 where the create alarm modal was added to the metrics landing page. Maybe it's isolated to that page?

[~dkavanagh]: Yeah, I don't see that issue elsewhere, although the Create Alarm dialog isn't warning of alarm name conflicts on the Instance monitoring page (looking at master).  Should it warn of a conflict there?
I'll look at what's changed in the metrics.scss that could have affected this.

[~jloza]: Here's an update of what I fixed and what needs discussion in the GUI-2504 branch...

Fixed:
- Increased Create Alarm dialog modal width to xlarge (95% of content wrapper width)
- Adjusted label/field columns for evaluation periods and alarm actions
- Enabled closing of dialog when clicking outside modal

Needs discussion:
- I haven't been able to implement the "slide down/up" transition -- tried a bunch of approaches w/o success.  Perhaps we should punt this to a separate ticket, wondering if we should disable it everywhere else for our Foundation dialogs?
- Padding for the custom modal dialog matches our Foundation dialogs elsewhere, so I need specifics on what should be changed here (and elsewhere?)

PR is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1884

Hi [~kgill], great start!

For the padding, the labels are all indented waaaay too far from the left margin of the dialog. The longest label should be as close to aligned with the section header as possible, please. 

Have you check with your teammates to see if anyone else has ideas on the animation transition? 

Also, the units should be the same style as the rest of the mad lib sentence labels, please.
Foundation doesn't use css-style animation. That kind is generally in response to user event like hover. Foundation uses javascript to manage it. We could do the same if needed.

I haven't had a chance to explore, but CSS animations do support keyframes:

https://css-tricks.com/using-multi-step-animations-transitions/

I believe we need two frames: one for displaying the modal background (grey overlay) and one for sliding in the modal.

PR 1884 updated with fixes from PR 1886 (merged to master, for create alarm dialog portion of GUI-2547) and with the following changes..

- Modify unit style in dialog to match other labels
- Implement slide down CSS animation
- Restored default create alarm modal dialog width to large size

[~ashamblin]: Could you code review this and merge since [~jloza] is out?  I can open a new branch if there are more style fixes required after Jenny's UX review.
[~ashamblin]: I pushed a couple of fixes based on your code review feedback.  Thanks for the suggestions!  Could you review again and merge if it looks good?
Assigning to myself for UX review. Back from being out.
Reviewing from master since the remote branch has been deleted

* labels remain indented much, much too far
* cancel link in actions section should be gray (green on hover no underline please), and needs more spacing between it and button
* CPU utilization, units no longer displaying...can't tell if styling there is right. screenshot attached.

[~jloza]: I've attached a screenshot of the create alarm dialog on the instance monitoring page, with the volume and ELB monitoring pages looking similar.  I suspect the styling issues you noted are in the Create Alarm dialog on the metrics landing page, which seems to have numerous issues that are isolated to that page.  Any ideas, [~dkavanagh]?

[~jloza]: Per an IRC discussion with [~dkavanagh], we're going to use the existing GUI-2466 ticket to track remaining issues on the create alarm dialog for the metrics landing page.  May I move this one back into review?
[~kgill] sure!

[~kgill], look at the create alarm dialog from instance details, that dialog is too narrow, why is it not using the wider modal? The labels are all wrapping still, and still seem indented too much from the left margin.

[~jloza]: The field label/input ratios are 3/9 column ratio atm.  I can bump that to a 2/10, but the labels will wrap more, although making the modal wider may help.  Bottom line is, there's a balancing act between the column ratios, the padding, and the label wrapping.  Please advise.
Please note that the markup for the action editor is reused on both the alarm detail page and the create alarm dialog.
[~ashamblin]: Good to know.  I'll hold off on changing the column ratios, since they look good on the alarm details page.  Will try bumping up the width of the create alarm dialog per se.
[~jloza]: I bumped up the width of the dialog and left the column ratios at 3/9 per Adam's comment.  Lemme know if it looks good now?
[~jloza]: Forgot to mention... use the new GUI-2504 branch to UX review my latest changes.
Hi [~kgill], getting there! Wrapping is better, but the labels are still indented way too far. Longest label should align with subsection header as closely as possible, please.

[~jloza]: I've attached a screenshot of the create alarm dialog with the 3/9 column ratios outlined in light gray (using web inspector) for illustration purposes.  The column ratios control where the labels end up, and changing those to a 2/10 ratio *may* allow some of the labels to have better alignment, albeit with label wrapping.  Please advise on if you want A) possibly better label alignment with label wrapping (by changing the column ratios to 2/10 or B) leave the alignment (3/9 column ratio) as is and not have the labels wrap.  There may be an option C here via flexbox, but those changes are fairly extensive and may cause regressions as portions of the create alarm dialog are used on the alarm details page.
Do they actually wrap at 2/10 in the larger dialog?

[~jloza]: I've attached a screenshot of the dialog after setting the column ratio to 2/10... there is label wrapping there.  I didn't modify the column ratios for the alarm actions editor (grayed out in my screenshot), but I suspect some of those labels would wrap as well at 2/10.
Sigh, Foundation can be so restrictive sometimes. Let's stay with the 3/9 and no wrapping. We'll look at general ways we can improve layout later. Thanks, [~kgill]!
Latest PR is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1895

UX review passed, pushed a change to GUI-2466 branch to address disabled add action button styling which fixes both spots. 

Ready for code review!
